title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Finance Minister Mathias Cormann says "a record" $100 billion is available for state infrastructure projects. Mr Cormann said it was up to each state and territory government to use the money. The finance minister told Sky News premiers were asked to identify which projects they could deliver quickly. Mr Cormann said former Labor Prime Ministers Kevin Rudd, Julia Gilliard and former Deputy Wayne Swan wasted billions on infrastructure projects “we didn’t need” like school halls and pink batts. “We are committed to ensure the funding goes into high-quality projects and is appropriately prioritised,” he said. Image: News Corp Australia
